trans-unit.source: Copy output data to an on-premises SQL Server database (Azure PowerShell)
trans-unit.target: Copy output data to an on-premises SQL Server database (Azure PowerShell)

trans-unit.source: This walkthrough extends the tutorial using Azure PowerShell such that the pipeline copies output data to a SQL Server database.
trans-unit.target: This walkthrough extends the tutorial using Azure PowerShell such that the pipeline copies output data to a SQL Server database.

trans-unit.source: In this walkthrough, you will learn how to set up the environment to enable the pipeline to work with your on-premises data.
trans-unit.target: In this walkthrough, you will learn how to set up the environment to enable the pipeline to work with your on-premises data.

trans-unit.source: In the last step of log processing scenario from the first walkthrough with Partition -> Enrich -> Analyze workflow, the marketing campaign effectiveness output was copied to an Azure SQL database.
trans-unit.target: In the last step of log processing scenario from the first walkthrough with Partition -> Enrich -> Analyze workflow, the marketing campaign effectiveness output was copied to an Azure SQL database.

trans-unit.source: You could also move this data to on-premises SQL Server for analytics within your organization.
trans-unit.target: You could also move this data to on-premises SQL Server for analytics within your organization.

trans-unit.source: In order to copy the marketing campaign effectiveness data from Azure Blob to on-premises SQL Server, you need to create additional on-premises Linked Service, Table and Pipeline using the same set of cmdlets introduced in the first walkthrough.
trans-unit.target: In order to copy the marketing campaign effectiveness data from Azure Blob to on-premises SQL Server, you need to create additional on-premises Linked Service, Table and Pipeline using the same set of cmdlets introduced in the first walkthrough.

trans-unit.source: You must perform the walkthrough in the Tutorial: Move and process log files using Data Factory[datafactorytutorial] before performing the walkthrough in this article.
trans-unit.target: You must perform the walkthrough in the Tutorial: Move and process log files using Data Factory[datafactorytutorial] before performing the walkthrough in this article.

trans-unit.source: (recommended) Review and practice the walkthrough in the Enable your pipeline to work with on-premises data[useonpremisesdatasources] article for a walkthrough on creating a pipeline to move data from on-premises SQL Server to an Azure blob store.
trans-unit.target: (recommended) Review and practice the walkthrough in the Enable your pipeline to work with on-premises data[useonpremisesdatasources] article for a walkthrough on creating a pipeline to move data from on-premises SQL Server to an Azure blob store.

trans-unit.source: In this walkthrough, you will perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: In this walkthrough, you will perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Step 1: Create a data management gateway</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Step 1: Create a data management gateway</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The Data Management Gateway is a client agent that provides access to on-premises data sources in your organization from the cloud.
trans-unit.target: The Data Management Gateway is a client agent that provides access to on-premises data sources in your organization from the cloud.

trans-unit.source: The gateway enables transfer of data between an on premise SQL Server and Azure data stores.
trans-unit.target: The gateway enables transfer of data between an on premise SQL Server and Azure data stores.

trans-unit.source: You must have at least one gateway installed in your corporate environment as well as register it with the Azure Data Factory before adding on-premises SQL Server database as a linked service to an Azure data factory.
trans-unit.target: You must have at least one gateway installed in your corporate environment as well as register it with the Azure Data Factory before adding on-premises SQL Server database as a linked service to an Azure data factory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Step 2: Create a linked service for the on-premises SQL Server</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Step 2: Create a linked service for the on-premises SQL Server</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: In this step, you first create a database and a table on your on-premises SQL Server computer and then create the linked service: OnPremSqlLinkedService.
trans-unit.target: In this step, you first create a database and a table on your on-premises SQL Server computer and then create the linked service: OnPremSqlLinkedService.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Step 3: Create table and pipeline</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Step 3: Create table and pipeline</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: In this step, you will create a table MarketingCampaignEffectivenessOnPremSQLTable and pipeline EgressDataToOnPremPipeline.
trans-unit.target: In this step, you will create a table MarketingCampaignEffectivenessOnPremSQLTable and pipeline EgressDataToOnPremPipeline.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Step 4: Monitor pipeline and view the result</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Step 4: Monitor pipeline and view the result</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: In this step, you will monitor the pipelines, tables, and data slices by using the Azure Portal.
trans-unit.target: In this step, you will monitor the pipelines, tables, and data slices by using the Azure Portal.

trans-unit.source: The Data Management Gateway is a client agent that provides access to on-premises data sources in your organization from the cloud.
trans-unit.target: The Data Management Gateway is a client agent that provides access to on-premises data sources in your organization from the cloud.

trans-unit.source: The gateway enables transfer of data between an on premise SQL Server and Azure data stores.
trans-unit.target: The gateway enables transfer of data between an on premise SQL Server and Azure data stores.

trans-unit.source: You must have at least one gateway installed in your corporate environment as well as register it with the Azure Data Factory before adding on-premises SQL Server database as a linked service to an Azure data factory.
trans-unit.target: You must have at least one gateway installed in your corporate environment as well as register it with the Azure Data Factory before adding on-premises SQL Server database as a linked service to an Azure data factory.

trans-unit.source: If you have an existing data gateway that you can use, skip this step.
trans-unit.target: If you have an existing data gateway that you can use, skip this step.

trans-unit.source: Create a logical data gateway.
trans-unit.target: Create a logical data gateway.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Preview Portal, click Linked Services on the DATA FACTORY blade.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Preview Portal, click Linked Services on the DATA FACTORY blade.

trans-unit.source: Click Add (+) Data Gateway on the command bar.
trans-unit.target: Click Add (+) Data Gateway on the command bar.

trans-unit.source: In the New data gateway blade, click CREATE.
trans-unit.target: In the New data gateway blade, click CREATE.

trans-unit.source: In the Create blade, enter MyGateway for the Data gateway name.
trans-unit.target: In the Create blade, enter MyGateway for the Data gateway name.

trans-unit.source: Click PICK A REGION and change it if needed.
trans-unit.target: Click PICK A REGION and change it if needed.

trans-unit.source: Click OK in the Create blade.
trans-unit.target: Click OK in the Create blade.

trans-unit.source: You should see the Configure blade.
trans-unit.target: You should see the Configure blade.

trans-unit.source: In the Configure blade, click Install directly on this computer.
trans-unit.target: In the Configure blade, click Install directly on this computer.

trans-unit.source: This will download, install, and configure the gateway on your computer and registers the gateway with the service.
trans-unit.target: This will download, install, and configure the gateway on your computer and registers the gateway with the service.

trans-unit.source: If you have an existing gateway installed on your computer that you want to link to this logical gateway on the portal, use the key on this blade to re-register your gateway using Data Management Gateway Configuration Manager (Preview) tool.
trans-unit.target: If you have an existing gateway installed on your computer that you want to link to this logical gateway on the portal, use the key on this blade to re-register your gateway using Data Management Gateway Configuration Manager (Preview) tool.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Data Management Gateway Configuration Manager</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Data Management Gateway Configuration Manager</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click OK to close the Configure blade and OK to close the Create blade.
trans-unit.target: Click OK to close the Configure blade and OK to close the Create blade.

trans-unit.source: Wait until the status of MyGateway in the Linked Services blade changes to GOOD.
trans-unit.target: Wait until the status of MyGateway in the Linked Services blade changes to GOOD.

trans-unit.source: You can also launch Data Management Gateway Configuration Manager (Preview) tool to confirm that the name of the gateway matches the name in the portal and the status is Registered.
trans-unit.target: You can also launch Data Management Gateway Configuration Manager (Preview) tool to confirm that the name of the gateway matches the name in the portal and the status is Registered.

trans-unit.source: You may have to close and reopen the Linked Services blade to see the latest status.
trans-unit.target: You may have to close and reopen the Linked Services blade to see the latest status.

trans-unit.source: It may take a few minutes before the screen is refreshed with the latest status.
trans-unit.target: It may take a few minutes before the screen is refreshed with the latest status.

trans-unit.source: In this step, you first create the required database and table on your on-premises SQL Server computer and then create the linked service.
trans-unit.target: In this step, you first create the required database and table on your on-premises SQL Server computer and then create the linked service.

trans-unit.source: To start with, you need to create the SQL Server database, table, user defined types and stored procedures.
trans-unit.target: To start with, you need to create the SQL Server database, table, user defined types and stored procedures.

trans-unit.source: These will be used for moving the MarketingCampaignEffectiveness results from Azure blob to SQL Server database.
trans-unit.target: These will be used for moving the MarketingCampaignEffectiveness results from Azure blob to SQL Server database.

trans-unit.source: In Windows Explorer, navigate to the OnPremises sub folder in C:\ADFWalkthrough (or the location where you have extracted the samples).
trans-unit.target: In Windows Explorer, navigate to the OnPremises sub folder in C:\ADFWalkthrough (or the location where you have extracted the samples).

trans-unit.source: Open prepareOnPremDatabase&Table.ps1 in your favorite editor, replace the highlighted with your SQL Server information and save the file (please provide SQL authentication details). For the purpose of the tutorial, enable SQL Authentication for your database.
trans-unit.target: Open prepareOnPremDatabase&Table.ps1 in your favorite editor, replace the highlighted with your SQL Server information and save the file (please provide SQL authentication details). For the purpose of the tutorial, enable SQL Authentication for your database.

trans-unit.source: In Azure PowerShell, navigate to C:\ADFWalkthrough\OnPremises folder.
trans-unit.target: In Azure PowerShell, navigate to C:\ADFWalkthrough\OnPremises folder.

trans-unit.source: Run prepareOnPremDatabase&Table.ps1 (either & in double quotes or as shown below).
trans-unit.target: Run prepareOnPremDatabase&Table.ps1 (either & in double quotes or as shown below).

trans-unit.source: Once the script executes successfully, you will see the following:
trans-unit.target: Once the script executes successfully, you will see the following:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Preview Portal, click Linked Services tile on the DATA FACTORY blade for LogProcessingFactory.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Preview Portal, click Linked Services tile on the DATA FACTORY blade for LogProcessingFactory.

trans-unit.source: In the Linked Services blade, click Add (+) Data Store.
trans-unit.target: In the Linked Services blade, click Add (+) Data Store.

trans-unit.source: In the New data store blade, enter OnPremSqlLinkedService for the Name.
trans-unit.target: In the New data store blade, enter OnPremSqlLinkedService for the Name.

trans-unit.source: Click Type (Settings required) and select SQL Server.
trans-unit.target: Click Type (Settings required) and select SQL Server.

trans-unit.source: You should see the DATA GATEWAY, Server, Database, and CREDENTIALS settings in the New data store blade now.
trans-unit.target: You should see the DATA GATEWAY, Server, Database, and CREDENTIALS settings in the New data store blade now.

trans-unit.source: Click DATA GATEWAY (configure required settings) and select MyGateway you had created earlier.
trans-unit.target: Click DATA GATEWAY (configure required settings) and select MyGateway you had created earlier.

trans-unit.source: Enter name of the database server that hosts the MarketingCampaigns database.
trans-unit.target: Enter name of the database server that hosts the MarketingCampaigns database.

trans-unit.source: Enter MarketingCampaigns for the Database.
trans-unit.target: Enter MarketingCampaigns for the Database.

trans-unit.source: Click CREDENTIALS.
trans-unit.target: Click CREDENTIALS.

trans-unit.source: In the Credentials blade, click Click here to set credentials securely.
trans-unit.target: In the Credentials blade, click Click here to set credentials securely.

trans-unit.source: It installs a one-click application for the first time and launches the *Setting Credentials *dialog box.
trans-unit.target: It installs a one-click application for the first time and launches the *Setting Credentials *dialog box.

trans-unit.source: In the Setting Credentials dialog box, enter User Name and Password, and click OK.
trans-unit.target: In the Setting Credentials dialog box, enter User Name and Password, and click OK.

trans-unit.source: Wait until the dialog box closes.
trans-unit.target: Wait until the dialog box closes.

trans-unit.source: Click OK in the New data store blade.
trans-unit.target: Click OK in the New data store blade.

trans-unit.source: In the Linked Services blade, confirm that OnPremSqlLinkedService shows up in the list and the status of the linked service is Good.
trans-unit.target: In the Linked Services blade, confirm that OnPremSqlLinkedService shows up in the list and the status of the linked service is Good.

trans-unit.source: In Azure PowerShell, switch to the C:\ADFWalkthrough\OnPremises folder.
trans-unit.target: In Azure PowerShell, switch to the C:\ADFWalkthrough\OnPremises folder.

trans-unit.source: Use the cmdlet New-AzureDataFactoryTable to create the Tables as follows for MarketingCampaignEffectivenessOnPremSQLTable.json.
trans-unit.target: Use the cmdlet New-AzureDataFactoryTable to create the Tables as follows for MarketingCampaignEffectivenessOnPremSQLTable.json.

trans-unit.source: Use the cmdlet New-AzureDataFactoryPipeline to create the Pipeline as follows for EgressDataToOnPremPipeline.json.
trans-unit.target: Use the cmdlet New-AzureDataFactoryPipeline to create the Pipeline as follows for EgressDataToOnPremPipeline.json.

trans-unit.source: Use the cmdlet Set-AzureDataFactoryPipelineActivePeriod to specify the active period for EgressDataToOnPremPipeline.
trans-unit.target: Use the cmdlet Set-AzureDataFactoryPipelineActivePeriod to specify the active period for EgressDataToOnPremPipeline.

trans-unit.source: Press ‘Y’ to continue.
trans-unit.target: Press ‘Y’ to continue.

trans-unit.source: You can now use the same steps introduced in <linkText>Step 6: Monitoring tables and pipelines</linkText><title></title> to monitor the new pipeline and the data slices for the new on-premises ADF table.
trans-unit.target: You can now use the same steps introduced in <linkText>Step 6: Monitoring tables and pipelines</linkText><title></title> to monitor the new pipeline and the data slices for the new on-premises ADF table.

trans-unit.source: When you see the status of a slice of the table MarketingCampaignEffectivenessOnPremSQLTable turns into Ready, it means that the pipeline have completed the execution for the slice.
trans-unit.target: When you see the status of a slice of the table MarketingCampaignEffectivenessOnPremSQLTable turns into Ready, it means that the pipeline have completed the execution for the slice.

trans-unit.source: To view the results, query the MarketingCampaignEffectiveness table in MarketingCampaigns database in your SQL Server.
trans-unit.target: To view the results, query the MarketingCampaignEffectiveness table in MarketingCampaigns database in your SQL Server.

trans-unit.source: Congratulations!
trans-unit.target: Congratulations!

trans-unit.source: You have successfully gone through the walkthrough to use your on-premises data source.
trans-unit.target: You have successfully gone through the walkthrough to use your on-premises data source.
